channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report X-2023080413
item.description:
Report X-2023080413

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-19
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/19/2023 at approximately 1250, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3724286 at the package research and recovery location in Olive Branch, reporting a undeclared lithium battery shipment. The package was discoverd at the location after being separated from its paperwork, but the shipment was not physically marked or labeled as a litrium battery shipment. This shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

THE CORROSION DAMAGE THE SIDES AND INSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PROPERLY HANDLED USING THE CORRECT HAZARDOUS MATERIALS NEED TO CLEAN UP THE LEAKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2023071056
item.description:
Report X-2023071056

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: PEARL
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The box was being unloaded and came off the trailer damaged. QA was called, the box was placed in a red tote and taken to the hazmat cage for processing. DPR was done and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: The top was loose and contents wasted out. They were 2 quart size plastic containers with liquid arsenal stripper. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was removed from the trailer and taken to the designated area. The little spill was cleaned up by QA

  • Description: 1. X-2023071048 SequenceEvent: Package was found under I C roller on unload Bank 2, partial damaged. The contents caps were loose, causing internal leakage. DescribePack: The corner of the package was damaged by the corrosive. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spill remained inside of package, content caps were tighten. No additional clean-up was needed. 2. X-2023080152 SequenceEvent: spill DescribePack: spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill. 3. X-2023080153 SequenceEvent: spill DescribePack: spill DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: spill.

item.title: Report X-2023061324
item.description:
Report X-2023061324

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 6/9/2023 at approximately 1330, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3724286 at the sort facility in Olive Branch, reporting an undeclared compressed gas cylinder. The shipment consisted of 15 fiberboard boxes, all containing various diving accessoeries. Due to lost paperwork, 3 of the packages were rerouted to the package research and recovery facility where further research revealed a compressed gas cylinder in one of the 3 packages. There were two black cylinders and 1 silver cylinder. This pacakge was prepared in accoradance with the IATA Regulations. The other 12 shipments appeared to move on in transit. The 3 packages are being held, pending an FAA investigation.
